definition: to invite/to provoke/to demand or ask for/to send armed forces to suppress/to denounce or condemn/to marry (a woman)/to discuss or study

sentences.english: Sir, in others' eye you are the greatest nuisance. You should not irritate them once more.
sentences.chinese: 同志，你最討人厭了，別再激怒其他人了啊。

sentences.english: You know, you're really becoming a grouch .
Of all men the drunkard is the foulest .
sentences.chinese: 男人中最討人厭的是酒鬼。

sentences.english: Pam said she didn’t see why Paul was being so pissy.
sentences.chinese: 帕姆說她弄不明白保羅爲什麼變得這麼討人厭了呢。

sentences.english: And I hate being the bitchy , naggy mom.
sentences.chinese: 我不想做一個討人厭的囉嗦母親。

sentences.english: Of all men the drunkard is the foulest.
sentences.chinese: 男人中最討人厭的是酒鬼。

sentences.english: Back off , Kit. You know, you're really becoming a grouch.
sentences.chinese: 別逼人，丫頭，知道嗎？你真的變成討人厭了。

definition: to like to look good in the eyes of others/sensitive about how one is regarded by others/proud
lit. going round the curves and skirting the corners (idiom)/fig. to speak in a roundabout way/to equivocate/to beat about the bush
to watch with amusement as sb makes a fool of himself
